NOTES (not included in the build): The Brunei language also has a different alphabet called 'Jawi',
which does not have a corresponding ISO 639 code. IGNORED.
MANY OFFICIAL LANGUAGES - Bolivian Constitution Archived on October 24, 2017, in the Internet Archive.
Article 5 of the Constitution recognizes Spanish as well as all the languages of the native nations
and peoples as official languages. The same article lists the following languages: Aymara, Araona,
Baure, Bésiro, Canichana, Cavineño, Cayubaba, Chácobo, Chimán, Ese Ejja, Guarani, Guarasu'we, Guarayu,
Itonama, Leco, Machajuyai-Kallawaya, Machineri, Maropa, Mojeño-Trinitario, Mojeño-Ignaciano, Moré,
Mosetén, Movima, Pacawara, Puquina, Quechua, Sirionó, Tacana, Tapiete, Toromona, Uru-Chipaya, Weenhayek,
The island has population 0 and no area dial code
